Claim: A post has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter which claims that a factory in the Australian city of Melbourne has been hoarding essential supplies including baby formula, toilet paper and hand sanitiser for export to China during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; police said the accusation was "false". The company cited in the misleading posts also refuted the claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter which claims that a factory in the Australian city of Melbourne has been hoarding essential supplies including baby formula, toilet paper and hand sanitiser for export to China during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; police said the accusation was "false". The company cited in the misleading posts also refuted the claim.

https://factcheck.afp.com/police-dismiss-false-claim-australian-factory-hoarded-covid-19-supplies-export-china

Claim: Manir Hossain, a 23-year-old man from India’s Tripura, died in a hospital in Malaysia due to the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Upon our investigation, we found the above news reports to be False. An Indian citizen from Tripura did not die due to coronavirus in Malaysia. The reason for his death is Status Epilepticus Secondary Meningoencephalitis.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Manir Hossain, a 23-year-old man from India’s Tripura, died in a hospital in Malaysia due to the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Upon our investigation, we found the above news reports to be False. An Indian citizen from Tripura did not die due to coronavirus in Malaysia. The reason for his death is Status Epilepticus Secondary Meningoencephalitis.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/05/fact-check-indian-citizen-from-tripura-did-not-die-due-to-coronavirus-in-malaysia/

Claim: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are “mild.”
Explaination: The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are “mild.”

Explanation:The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/viral-image/are-80-percent-coronavirus-cases-mild/

Claim: Coronavirus is in Des Moines. (Jan. 29)
Explaination: The story came from a prank website where it got over 9000 Facebook engagements
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus is in Des Moines. (Jan. 29)

Explanation:The story came from a prank website where it got over 9000 Facebook engagements

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471548-fake-news-coronavirus-des-moines.html

Claim: Video shows quarantined people in a building in Shanghai.
Explaination: This video shows tower blocks in Shanghai, not Wuhan – and the clip has been edited to include the audio
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video shows quarantined people in a building in Shanghai.

Explanation:This video shows tower blocks in Shanghai, not Wuhan – and the clip has been edited to include the audio

http://u.afp.com/QuarantineChina

Claim: A picture showing dead Italian doctors in an operating theater after succumbing to COVID-19.
Explaination: The picture showing doctors on the floor of an operating room is actually from an episode of Grey's Anatomy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A picture showing dead Italian doctors in an operating theater after succumbing to COVID-19.

Explanation:The picture showing doctors on the floor of an operating room is actually from an episode of Grey's Anatomy.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-photo-does-not-show-italian-doctors-who-succumbed-to-covid-19-b02ea97240db?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: The WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, Ecuador, on 2/2/20.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: The WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, Ecuador, on 2/2/20.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=2

Claim: “While all COVID-19 news has been going on, the U.S. government has been sneakily trying to remove end-to-end encryption” which means “the government will be able to see all of your messages and listen to all of your calls.”
Explaination: A bill currently being considered by Congress, called the EARN IT Act, would make it easier for law enforcement to demand information from technology companies about certain users of their services. The bill wouldn't grant unlimited access. Any request would have to be premised on a link to suspected child exploitation.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “While all COVID-19 news has been going on, the U.S. government has been sneakily trying to remove end-to-end encryption” which means “the government will be able to see all of your messages and listen to all of your calls.”

Explanation:A bill currently being considered by Congress, called the EARN IT Act, would make it easier for law enforcement to demand information from technology companies about certain users of their services. The bill wouldn't grant unlimited access. Any request would have to be premised on a link to suspected child exploitation.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/09/instagram-posts/government-sneakily-trying-change-encryption-rules/

Claim: A video shows crows are flocking to Wuhan.
Explaination: This video shows crows in the Chinese city of Xining -- 1,000 miles from Wuhan.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video shows crows are flocking to Wuhan.

Explanation:This video shows crows in the Chinese city of Xining -- 1,000 miles from Wuhan.

http://u.afp.com/notWuhancrows

Claim: Coronavirus has killed 112,000 people and infected 2,800,000 in China.
Explaination: Till the time of writing this article, coronavirus had killed more than 400 people and infected over 20,000 in China.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Coronavirus has killed 112,000 people and infected 2,800,000 in China.

Explanation:Till the time of writing this article, coronavirus had killed more than 400 people and infected over 20,000 in China.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-bloated-casualty-figures-linked-to-coronavirus-leave-netizens-in-panic-1643257-2020-02-04

Claim: Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi.
Explaination: Contrary to the claim, the incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi.

Explanation:Contrary to the claim, the incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/death-in-tamil-nadu-shared-as-delhi-coronavirus-case-fact-check

Claim: A screenshot of a purported news broadcast showing a lion in the street and reporting that Russia has deployed hundreds of lions to maintain order during the novel coronavirus lockdown has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A screenshot of a purported news broadcast showing a lion in the street and reporting that Russia has deployed hundreds of lions to maintain order during the novel coronavirus lockdown has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-was-taken-south-africa-2016-it-unrelated-coronavirus-pandemic

Claim: A couple of videos shared this month on Facebook purportedly show recent lootings in shops in South Africa, while the country undergoes a 21-day lockdown to minimize the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: However, both videos show footage of earlier looting incidents and were already circulating online last year.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A couple of videos shared this month on Facebook purportedly show recent lootings in shops in South Africa, while the country undergoes a 21-day lockdown to minimize the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:However, both videos show footage of earlier looting incidents and were already circulating online last year.

https://factcheck.afp.com/no-these-videos-do-not-show-recent-looting-south-africa

Claim: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitizer.
Explaination: It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitizer.

Explanation:It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-sanitiser-burn-1659085-2020-03-24

Claim: Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.”
Explaination: The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.
Label: HALF TRUE
html:
Claim: Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.”

Explanation:The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/donald-trump/stock-market-record-point-rise-followed-record-poi/

Claim: A photo has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coffins of coronavirus victims in Italy.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photo has circulated in media reports since 2009 about the coffins of earthquake victims in the Italian city of L'Aquila.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coffins of coronavirus victims in Italy.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photo has circulated in media reports since 2009 about the coffins of earthquake victims in the Italian city of L'Aquila.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-about-coffins-earthquake-victims-italy-2009

Claim: A video claims to show an Eid prayer in China in December 2019.
Explaination: This is a prayer in China in June 19, not related to Cov.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video claims to show an Eid prayer in China in December 2019.

Explanation:This is a prayer in China in June 19, not related to Cov.

http://u.afp.com/EidPrayer

Claim: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.
Explaination: This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.

Explanation:This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-russia-released-500-lions-to-stay-people-at-home/

Claim: Dr. Vandana Tiwari, part of the team investigating and identifying attendees of Tablighi Jamaat in U.P’s Bareilly who were attacked by them succumbed to her injuries today
Explaination: Dr. Vandana Tiwari is actually from the Indian state of MP and she passed away due to brain hemorrhage and not was not part of any investigating team in Uttar Pradesh.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Dr. Vandana Tiwari, part of the team investigating and identifying attendees of Tablighi Jamaat in U.P’s Bareilly who were attacked by them succumbed to her injuries today

Explanation:Dr. Vandana Tiwari is actually from the Indian state of MP and she passed away due to brain hemorrhage and not was not part of any investigating team in Uttar Pradesh.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/death-of-a-doctor-in-mp-shared-with-a-communal-angle-amidst-covid-19/

Claim: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.
Explaination: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.

Explanation:There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/no-evidence-to-back-covid-19-ibuprofen-concerns/

Claim: An Australian couple ordered wine by drone on a Princess Cruise ship.
Explaination: The couple said it was a prank.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An Australian couple ordered wine by drone on a Princess Cruise ship.

Explanation:The couple said it was a prank.

https://factcheck.afp.com/australian-couple-quarantined-onboard-diamond-princess-cruise-reveal-wine-drone-delivery-story-was

Claim: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.
Explaination: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.

Explanation:But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

https://factcheck.afp.com/red-soap-white-handkerchiefs-experts-refute-misleading-coronavirus-prevention-tips

Claim: Videos of a patient gasping for breath is shown as a patient from India.
Explaination: The video is not from India but Ecuador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Videos of a patient gasping for breath is shown as a patient from India.

Explanation:The video is not from India but Ecuador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/covid-19-video-of-patient-gasping-for-breath-falsely-linked-to-india-7439

Claim: An Image is being shared on social media claiming; this italian doctor couple in the picture worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they caught coronavirus and died after an hour.
Explaination: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: An Image is being shared on social media claiming; this italian doctor couple in the picture worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they caught coronavirus and died after an hour.

Explanation:The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15350708

Claim: Posts on social media claim there is a US patent for the novel coronavirus and a European patent for a vaccine, citing specific patent numbers.
Explaination: This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.
Label: False

annotations.label: Consp
annotations.remark: Also relates to virus origins and vaccines

html:
Claim: Posts on social media claim there is a US patent for the novel coronavirus and a European patent for a vaccine, citing specific patent numbers.

Explanation:This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.

https://factcheck.afp.com/false-claims-patents-fuel-novel-coronavirus-conspiracy-theories-online

Claim: The viral video claims to show the visuals of China police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.
Explaination: The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The viral video claims to show the visuals of China police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.

Explanation:The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15267158

Claim: Saint Luke’s Hospital of the USA says consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19.
Explaination: Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Saint Luke’s Hospital of the USA says consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19.

Explanation:Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/coronavirus-fact-check-claims-on-alcohol-and-covid-19-1654812-2020-03-12

Claim: “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” – (Jan. 28)
Explaination: Kabisnes’s false and clickbait headline does not reflect its content. In the video’s first 10 seconds, the show host reads the phrase “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” then proceeds to say that it was a claim circulating on social media, currently being debunked by Malacanang and DOH.
Label: Misleading

annotations.label: None
annotations.remark: wasn't clear what the claim is about

html:
Claim: “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” – (Jan. 28)

Explanation:Kabisnes’s false and clickbait headline does not reflect its content. In the video’s first 10 seconds, the show host reads the phrase “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” then proceeds to say that it was a claim circulating on social media, currently being debunked by Malacanang and DOH.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-no-novel-coronavirus-ph-youtube-channe

Claim: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.
Explaination: The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but it was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.

Explanation:The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but it was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471805-Fact-Check-A-Journalist-Did-NOT-Claim-A-Coronavirus-Patient-Was-Murdered.html

Claim: “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”
Explaination: Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”

Explanation:Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/instagram-posts/vegan-instagram-accounts-spread-misinformation-abo/

Claim: A WhatsApp forward, along with a video, is doing the rounds in which it is claimed that a person who belongs to the Tablighi Jamaat was kept in an isolation ward where he started wandering naked. The viral forward also claims that the person who was wandering naked did this vulgar act intentionally.
Explaination: The video being circulated in the name of Tablighi Jamaat members’ misbehaving with the nurses treating them for the COVID-19 is old. Hence it is evident that the viral claim is ‘False’ and is being shared with a communal angle.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A WhatsApp forward, along with a video, is doing the rounds in which it is claimed that a person who belongs to the Tablighi Jamaat was kept in an isolation ward where he started wandering naked. The viral forward also claims that the person who was wandering naked did this vulgar act intentionally.

Explanation:The video being circulated in the name of Tablighi Jamaat members’ misbehaving with the nurses treating them for the COVID-19 is old. Hence it is evident that the viral claim is ‘False’ and is being shared with a communal angle.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15610172

Claim: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/254838-robredo-suggests-inhaling-cough-back-prevent-coronavirus-spread
